creator: sdfgeoff
title: Digital Painting Lesson 2: A feather
materials_required: Gimp (or photoshop if you can translate to the tools there)
description: This tutorial teaches how to digitally paint a feather and its environment (a beach) using Gimp (or Photoshop) and a graphics tablet. It focuses on using digital tools to simplify the process and achieve complex-looking results.
steps: Set up your digital painting environment, including computer, graphics tablet, and Gimp or Photoshop.
Understand the basic structure of a feather: a tapering cylinder for the spine, fluff at the base, and a neat bit of the feather.
Create a custom feather brush in Gimp by selecting a brush with lots of dots (e.g., 'Galaxy (AP)') and adjusting the spacing to create parallel lines.
Draw the vane of the feather on a new layer, adjusting brush size based on pressure to create a taper. Shade it to appear round using a brush set to 'hard light', then adjust brightness and contrast.
Add the fluff to the feather by drawing with the custom brush on a separate layer, positioning it behind the vane. Use the eraser with the same brush to refine the shape.
Create a beach environment for the feather by first creating the base colors of sand, using a gradient tool for a wet-to-dry effect. Add noise and a bump-map filter to make the sand grainy.

Integrate the feather into the environment by adding a shadow (duplicating the feather, making it black, blurring it, and adjusting opacity) and shading the sand to create a small depression around the feather.

Add water to the beach scene on a new layer, using a dark blue brush and setting the layer to grain merge at a low opacity. Create foam using a white brush, also set to grain merge. Tweak colors as needed.
